description: Contraction of snivel. Compare drool, from drivel.

entries.meaning: (UK, dialect, archaic) An abject, cowardly person who submits tamely to others.

verbs.description: snool (third-person singular simple present snools, present participle snooling, simple past and past participle snooled)

entries.meaning: (UK, dialect, archaic, intransitive) To submit tamely to others.
